_header: As I me rode this ender day
_description: A Love Adventure — reconstructed as three 7-line stanzas (ababbbc) with 3-line burden: ‘Nou sprinkes the sprai / Al for loue icche am so seek / Þat slepen i ne mai’

LincInnH135.First Lines:
þis endre dai als i me rodeo mi [pleyinge]s[ei]h i hwar a
                    litel maibigan to singge…
LincInnH135.Last Lines: …þiif i mai it shal him rewebi this dai
LincInnH135.Note:
MS owned by Alan de Thornton, landowner in Lincolnshire and employed by
                    the abbot of Ramsey, c. 1297.
